Dear Ms. Hellman:
Attached is the Renewal Inspection Report for the above referenced agency completed
on 01/08/2025. Due to the violations of applicable licensing rules, a written corrective
action plan is required. The corrective action plan is due 15 days from the date of this
letter and must include the following:
• For any repeat violations, why the prior corrective action plan did not result
in compliance.
• How compliance with each citation will be achieved.
• Who is directly responsible for implementing the action steps in the
corrective action plan.
• Specific time frames for each citation as to when the correction will be
completed or implemented.
• How continuing compliance will be maintained once compliance is
achieved.
• The signature of the responsible party and a date.
If you fail to submit an acceptable corrective action plan, disciplinary action may result.

III. DESCRIPTION OF FINDINGS
The facility is in compliance with all applicable licensing statutes and rules except for
the following:
CPA Rule 400.12306 Application request
• (3) An agency shall provide the licensee an
application for renewal of the license and
document the action not less than 60 calendar
days before the expiration date of the license. A
renewal application must be provided to a
licensee, regardless of any pending
recommendation for disciplinary action of the
license.
Two of two foster homes reviewed documented that the renewal application was
sent to the foster parents less than sixty days before expiration of the license.
IV. TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE
The facility was offered technical assistance in the following area:
.
• Rule 400.12209 (2) (a) Orientation and Training. The agency was informed
that all training requirements listed under (2) (a) are required yearly for foster
care workers carrying a caseload as well as for supervisors who may be
carrying a caseload.

• DCWL review of Corrective Action Plans (CAP). The agency was informed
that starting January 1, 2024, interim and renewal audit CAP's will be
reviewed with the agency at three months and six months. The assigned
Consultant for the agency will work with the agency in conducting CAP
reviews. This process for special investigation CAP reviews was implemented
previously.
V. CONSULTATION
• Consultation was not requested or offered at this time.
VI. EVALUATION OF RENEWAL PERIOD
There were no substantiated incidents of maltreatment in care during this licensing
period.
There were no incidents of substantiated corporal punishment during this licensing
period.
Corrective Action Plan Compliance
The agency has not been required to submit any corrective action plans during
this period under review.
Chief Administrator Assessment
The Chief Administrators annual assessment was submitted and reviewed. The
Chief Administrator noted that recruitment of foster homes is slow and difficult. It
was also noted that staff have multiple roles at the organization which can result in
staff being overburdened at times with responsibilities. The agency was not cited
for any rule violations in the last inspection therefore the assessment did not
contain a review of a CAP.
Financial Overview
Financial records were reviewed including an annual budget and a certified public
accountant audit of the facility. No concerns were noted
Staff and Youth Interviews
Staff reported they enjoy working for the agency and were happy about progress
in recruitment and licensing of foster homes. The licensing worker reported that
she feels supported by her supervisor and they work well together.
Description of Agency Walk Through
The agency is located in a modern community mental health building in Kingsford
in the upper peninsula. There is adequate office space and resources. CHRI
documents were observed to be secured as required.

VII. FIELD ANALYST FINDINGS
The agency is non-contracted therefore the CPA Analyst was not required to visit
foster homes.
VIII. RECOMMENDATION
Based on inspection findings the agency is not in compliance with all applicable
licensing statutes and rules. Upon receipt of an acceptable corrective action plan, it
is recommended that the agency will be issued a renewal of their regular license.
